thread.title: UPDATE -- HotSchedules’ Mary Hamill Recognized by Hospitality Technology

author: cnbc.com
title: UPDATE -- HotSchedules’ Mary Hamill Recognized by Hospitality Technology
text:
AUSTIN, Texas and ATLANTA, April 05, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- HotSchedules ®, provider of Clarifi™, the first cloud-based intelligent operating platform for restaurants, today announced that Mary Hamill, Vice President of Sales Solutions, has been named a 2018 Top Women in Restaurant Technology Awards winner by Hospitality Technology magazine. Hamill was one of 10 women recognized overall and one of six in her category.
The Top Women in Restaurant Technology Awards seek to honor outstanding women from both restaurants and technology suppliers for reimagining restaurant processes and operations while demonstrating excellence in leadership, inventiveness and skill.
“I’m grateful to receive this award and to be recognized by an industry I’ve served for so many years. I congratulate my fellow honorees for their ongoing contributions to their companies and our industry,” said Hamill. “I’m proud to work for an employer that prioritizes innovation and gives all its team members the opportunity to work on challenging, fulfilling projects designed to deliver better hospitality to more people.”
“These impressive professionals are recognized for outstanding achievement in helping to reimagine restaurant processes and operations. The emerging cracks in the glass ceiling are in large part due to the efforts and achievements of women like this,” said Editor Dorothy Creamer.
During her 20-plus year career in the industry, Hamill served as a VP of Human Resources and VP of HR & Information Technology for brands like Fuddruckers and Max & Erma’s.
“Mary’s experience and history in the restaurant industry make her an invaluable member of our executive leadership team, our company and our industry,” said Mike Arenth, CEO at HotSchedules. “Her team is on the tip of the spear of the issues facing operations, finance and IT professionals. Last year alone, our solutions team consulted with and supported thousands of restaurants and some of the industry’s most well-known brands.”
Hamill and her peers in the “Innovation” category were recognized for being forward-thinkers who are transforming the foodservice tech space by deploying emerging solutions that reimagine how things are done, while paving the way for future technologies.
A complete list of the 2018 Top Women in Restaurant Technology Awards winners can be found here: https://hospitalitytech.com/2018-top-women-restaurant-technology
About HotSchedules
HotSchedules works with over 33,000 customers – from large international chains to some of the hottest new concepts. With a continual focus on innovation, HotSchedules provides innovative technology, services and user experiences for the restaurant, retail and hospitality industries, including Clarifi, the first cloud-based intelligent operating platform. Designed for independents, multi-unit franchise operators and international enterprise brands, HotSchedules serves over 2.8 million users across 159,000 locations in 56 countries helping them control costs, maintain compliance, improve visibility, increase profitability and drive operational consistency.
About Hospitality Technology
Hospitality Technology (HT) is the only publication dedicated to covering the role of information technology in improving business performance for hotel and restaurant operators. The Hospitality Technology editorial portfolio includes a print publication that publishes nine times annually and reaches more than 16,000 hospitality industry executives, three networking and educational events (MURTEC, HT-NEXT and Restaurant Executive Summit), a comprehensive website, e-newsletters, web seminars and several exclusive annual reports and studies. Visit Hospitality Technology online at http://www.hospitalitytech.com . Hospitality Technology is published by Chicago-based EnsembleIQ.
